column4: Hello, I'm using a ATI Radeon x700 Mobility Graphics card and when I use "glxinfo | grep -i direct" I get thre return of "direct rendering: No (If you want to find out why, try setting LIBGL_DEBUG=verbose)" I'm currently trying to get OpenGL to work in order to play a game in Wine. Any help with this would be greatly appreciated:)
what Xorg module are you using?
you probably should be using ati module
I have this in my xorg.conf http://pastebin.com/m669d7404
I was under the impression that fglrx was not required for legacy chipsets
I have no idea I'm rather new to the whole Linux thing so I'm drwaing a blank.
you could try replacing the fglrx line here:         Driver          "fglrx" <--- and change to Driver       "vesa"
make sure to backup your /etc/X11/xorg.conf and make the changes, then restart X
since xorg.conf is owned by user/group root, you'll have to launch an editor with root permission like this: gksudo gedit /etc/X11/xorg.conf
if when you restart X, it should fail to start, then you should go to recovery console and invoke the command
